snippet: The German Expressionist sculptor Kaethe Kollwitz, whose work was so anti-war the Nazis banned it, labored for 15 years to express in stone her grief at losing her 18-year-old son Peter at the start of World War One....

headline.print_headline: 'Grieving Parents' Statues Wend Way Across Europe for War Dead
headline.main: 'Grieving Parents' Statues Wend Way Across Europe for War Dead

lead_paragraph: The German Expressionist sculptor Kaethe Kollwitz, whose work was so anti-war the Nazis banned it, labored for 15 years to express in stone her grief at losing her 18-year-old son Peter at the start of World War One.
